ratings.comment: Listening to Don lecture, I realized he might be a genius. He knows the material so well and is surprisingly funny for a professor. But beware, he can move pretty quick during class. You will miss important info and need to go back to look at the slides. Overall, a wonderful man who will make you passionate about whatever he's teaching you.

The class is slightly problematic on its own, but I still loved it. There are pop quizzes, in-class writing checks, and the tests do rely heavily on book material, but Waller makes it worth it. He is clearly very passionate about the field, and explains concepts clearly. He's really funny, and I always look forward to his lectures. Take this class!

One of my favorite professors at the UW.  He expects a lot out of his students, but if you put the effort in, his classes are very rewarding.  He knows a lot about the subject and clearly enjoys it.  I found him to be generally a very interesting and like-able person and a great teacher.

Was not very happy with Waller as a professor. Lectures were messy and he put way to much information on the sides for how quickly he went through them. Quizzes were annoying and hard but what really sucked was the exams. They were EXTREMELY specific with tiny details from the book. We were responsible for every page of the 18 chapter book.

He's very passionate about the subject, but the exam are really hard. He doesn't make study guides, but he did pull a few questions from the book MC section.  With that said, READ THE BOOK. Most of exam material comes from the book.

The average for 1st midterm was ~65; it was all M.C and he even threw out 4 questions. With that low average, he said he was disappointed at our performance. Seriously? and then he gave a pop quiz right after the first midterm in the class.Very arrogant attitude and forwards every single e-mail to the WHOLE class even if it is personal. AVOID!!!!!!

I am writing this mid-term.I was warned to no take this class with him, I didn't listen becaue it fit into my schedule nicely. Mistake. Pop quizzes.TON of reading and you must read for details becaue random sentences are pulled for exam questios. The quizzes in class get really old. The problem sets are the worst ever. This class eats your time.

He knows his stuff, but I didn't enjoy his teaching. His power points were straight from the book, so if you read it was very boring. But there were concepts from just the book on the exams. At times, he came off as arrogant and his lectures were biased based on his political beliefs.

Extremely passionate and insightful professor. Does not above you, but expects you to have cursory knowledge of basic tenets of biological sciences (including genetics and evolution). Rightfully expects students to read and study the material.
Expects you to basically memorize every chapter. Has very specific questions in the exams. For first two exams, A's were 84 and 81. Does not cover enough in lectures, so you must read the text book.

Enjoyed the class a lot. One of my favorite professors. He says at the start of the semester that you need to read the book, so if you don't at least skim it, the class may be hard. If you do read though, it is easy. Very generous curves. Also, it's a class on evolution, can't expect him to tiptoe around creationists non evidence based theories.

I agree that pop quizzes were annoying (and first exam was hard too), but he promised not to make such tests again (it was his first time teaching the class and he was looking for feedback). The next few quizzes and exams were fair; I thought they were appropriate. His lectures were awesome and interesting, and very interactive. I loved this class.

Speaks above you. Expects you to know exactly what he means. Asks a lot of open ended questions in lecture. NEED to read the book. Very Difficult exams. He is passionate about what he's teaching, but it is not presented in an interesting manner. Take this class only if its with another professor.

very interesting professor, knows his stuff and has true passion for subject. reading necessary to keep up with class. discussion somewhat helpful. lots of pop quizzes mostly about reading, few problem sets throughout the semester. 2 (tricky) multiple choice exams + final. stay on top of reading and pay some attention in lecture and u'll be fin

Hoped I could just go to lecture, take notes, study, and do well. Not really the case. There are pop Qs that are a significant part of your final grade that have material on it that is not in lecture but rather part of the reading. Pop Qs happen a LOT, which did not work for me because I was going to miss class a lot for interviews. Had to drop.

He taught the evolution unit in Bio 151. He has pop quizzes which none of the other lecturers for the class did, really annoying. For his exam, on your notecard fit every phloygenetic tree on there with the characteristics of each group, FOR REAL. You need to know relationships. Having this literally SAVED me on the exam.
None

Fantastic professor.  Lectures are clear and engaging, and he clearly cares very much about the success of his students.  I highly recommend the course, especially for those who want to be well-informed citizens regarding the environment.

Prof. Waller revamped his lecture for Intro Ecology in the Fall of 2009.  He dubbed it "Ecology for Voters", and covers current ecological and environmental issues.  Very interesting and topical.  He's  passionate about teaching and an organized, interesting speaker.  Take this great class while you have the chance at UW!
He is very knowledgeable and presents information in a clear, organized way. Great professor!

I will admit, he does tend to sound biased, and I was irritated that he belittles opposing viewpoints; this seemed less-than-professional. He is enthusiastic, and ignoring repetition, I learned a lot in this class. The exams were fine and had large curves, and the books were interesting for the most part. Not bad for biological science credit.

I thought he was a very knowledgeable professor, with many opinions. Most people would see this as a bad thing, but obviously, his opinions are based off the truth. There are many environmental problems. Period. He was a very enthusiastic professor and you don't get that often.

A waste of time; the prof is not coherent, does not lecture well, does not know his material, tells us his opinions more than facts, is extremely liberal and unwilling to accept opposing ideas. He tells bad jokes, and the sound of his voice has gotten to the point where it makes me want to cry because I hate him so much. The class is terrible.
No Comments

the class is fairly interesting, exams are multiple choice yet they are still difficult.  he answers questions during lecture and is pretty concerned about his students' performance and understanding of the topics.

If you like learning personal opinion as fact,this is the class for you. The material was interesting,but Waller was constantly pushing extreme left-wing views. He even made fun of oposing theory and beliefs in the final. Obviously not promoting an open-minded education. Biased liberal.Poor teacher.
